intro: Rhetinocarpha, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit and is typically found in rocky or alpine environments. The plants produce small, cruciform flowers that are usually white or yellow in color. Rhetinocarpha species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor soils. They play an important role in stabilizing soil in their native habitats.
